results.adx_keywords: Appointments and Executive Changes;Butler, Laphonza;Newsom, Gavin;Feinstein, Dianne;Emily's List;Senate;California;San Francisco (Calif)
results.title: Newsom Names Emily’s List President as Feinstein Successor
results.abstract: Laphonza Butler will fill the Senate vacancy left by the death of Dianne Feinstein, the governor announced Sunday.

media.caption: Laphonza Butler has been a fixture in California politics for nearly 15 years as a former leader of the state’s largest labor union and an adviser to Vice President Kamala Harris.

results.adx_keywords: Missing Persons;Kidnapping and Hostages;Rescues;Sena, Charlotte;Ross, Craig Nelson Jr;Moreau Lake State Park (NY)
results.title: Missing Girl, 9, Found Safe in New York, and Suspect Is Arrested
results.abstract: Charlotte Sena went missing during an early evening bike ride on Saturday in Moreau Lake State Park. A suspect was arrested after police matched a fingerprint.

media.caption: Charlotte Sena, 9, had been missing since Saturday after she disappeared while on a camping trip in upstate New York. She was found on Monday.
media.copyright: Cindy Schultz for The New York Times

results.title: Russia May Be Planning to Test a Nuclear-Powered Missile
results.abstract: Visual evidence from a remote base in the Arctic shows launch preparations mirroring those that preceded earlier tests.

media.caption: A satellite image of the Russian Arctic, where activity around a missile launch site suggests Russia is preparing to test a nuclear-powered missile with a theoretical range of thousands of miles.

results.title: Why the ‘Mother of the Atomic Bomb’ Never Won a Nobel Prize
results.abstract: Lise Meitner developed the theory of nuclear fission, the process that enabled the atomic bomb. But her identity — Jewish and a woman — barred her from sharing credit for the discovery, newly translated letters show.

media.caption: Lise Meitner, the Austrian-born physicist, was a longtime collaborator of Otto Hahn, who won the Nobel Prize in 1944. She did not share in the award with him.

results.title: They Ran for a Better Life, Straight Into a Wildfire
results.abstract: Greek authorities assumed the victims were asylum seekers because no one was looking for missing people locally. And for more than a month, their identities, and the circumstances of their deaths, remained a mystery.

results.title: Two People Killed by Grizzly Bear at Banff National Park in Canada
results.abstract: Park officials found the victims early Saturday morning, after receiving an alert from a satellite device hours earlier. A grizzly near the site displayed “aggressive behavior,” they said.

media.caption: Park authorities in Canada said they received an alert from inside Banff National Park in Alberta, where two people were found dead.

results.title: Evelyn Fox Keller, Who Turned a Feminist Lens on Science, Dies at 87
results.abstract: Trained as a physicist and biologist, she argued that science had become gendered, with a narrow masculine framework that distorted inquiry.

media.caption: The scientist Evelyn Fox Keller in 2005. She wrote widely about the way ideas of masculinity and femininity had affected her profession.

results.title: The Americans Most Threatened by Eviction: Young Children
results.abstract: About a quarter of Black babies and toddlers in rental households face the threat of eviction in a typical year, a new study says, and all children are disproportionately at risk.

results.title: Gaetz Moves to Oust McCarthy, Threatening His Grip on the Speakership
results.abstract: The move forces a vote within days on whether to keep the speaker in his post, a challenge that only two other House speakers have faced in the history of the chamber.

media.caption: Representative Matt Gaetz’s animus toward Speaker Kevin McCarthy extends far beyond the most recent funding skirmish.
